Fields

AabbExtension

This is used to fatten AABBs in the dynamic tree. This allows proxies to move by a small amount without triggering a tree adjustment. This is in meters.

public const float AabbExtension = 0.1

Field Value

float

AabbMultiplier

This is used to fatten AABBs in the dynamic tree. This is used to predict the future position based on the current displacement. This is a dimensionless multiplier.

public const float AabbMultiplier = 4

Field Value

float

AngularCorrection

The maximum angular position correction used when solving constraints. This helps to prevent overshoot.

public const float AngularCorrection = 0.13962635

Field Value

float

AngularSleepTolerance

A body cannot sleep if its angular velocity is above this tolerance.

public const float AngularSleepTolerance = 0.03490659

Field Value

float

AngularSlop

A small angle used as a collision and constraint tolerance. Usually it is chosen to be numerically significant, but visually insignificant.

public const float AngularSlop = 0.03490659

Field Value

float

AutoClearForces

By default, forces are cleared automatically after each call to Step. The default behavior is modified with this setting. The purpose of this setting is to support sub-stepping. Sub-stepping is often used to maintain a fixed sized time step under a variable frame-rate. When you perform sub-stepping you should disable auto clearing of forces and instead call ClearForces after all sub-steps are complete in one pass of your game loop.

public const bool AutoClearForces = true

Field Value

bool

Baumgarte

This scale factor controls how fast overlap is resolved. Ideally this would be 1 so that overlap is removed in one time step. However using values close to 1 often lead to overshoot.

public const float Baumgarte = 0.2

Field Value

float

BlockSolve

Enable or disable the block contact solver. Used for debugging.

internal const bool BlockSolve = true

Field Value

bool

public const short DefaultCollisionGroup = 0

This is used by the Fixture constructor as the default value for Fixture.CollisionCategories member. Note that you may need to change this depending on the setting of UseFPECollisionCategories, above.

public const Category DefaultFixtureCollisionCategories = Cat1

ManifoldPoints

The maximum number of contact points between two convex shapes. DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE!

internal const int ManifoldPoints = 2

Field Value

int

MixFriction

Gets called when there is a collision between 2 fixtures. The first two parameters are the friction values of either fixture. The return value should be the desired friction value of the collection.

public static readonly Func<float, float, float> MixFriction

Field Value

Func<float, float, float>

MixRestitution

Gets called when there is a collision between 2 fixtures. The first two parameters are the restitution values of either fixture. The return value should be the desired restitution value of the collection.

public static readonly Func<float, float, float> MixRestitution

Field Value

Func<float, float, float>

MixRestitutionThreshold

The default mix restitution threshold

Field Value

Func<float, float, float>

PolygonRadius

The radius of the polygon/edge shape skin. This should not be modified. Making this smaller means polygons will have an insufficient buffer for continuous collision. Making it larger may create artifacts for vertex collision.

public static readonly float PolygonRadius

Field Value

float

PolygonVertices

The maximum number of vertices on a convex polygon.

public const int PolygonVertices = 8

Field Value

int

Rotation

The maximum angular velocity of a body. This limit is very large and is used to prevent numerical problems. You shouldn't need to adjust this.

public const float Rotation = 1.5707964

Field Value

float

SkipSanityChecks

Set this to true to skip sanity checks in the engine. This will speed up the tools by removing the overhead of the checks, but you will need to handle checks yourself where it is needed.

internal const bool SkipSanityChecks = false

Field Value

bool

SubSteps

Maximum number of sub-steps per contact in continuous physics simulation.

public const int SubSteps = 8

int

TimeToSleep

The time that a body must be still before it will go to sleep.

public const float TimeToSleep = 0.5

ToiContacts

Maximum number of contacts to be handled to solve a TOI impact.

public const int ToiContacts = 32

Field Value

int

Translation

The maximum linear velocity of a body. This limit is very large and is used to prevent numerical problems. You shouldn't need to adjust this.

public const float Translation = 2

Field Value

float

UseConvexHullPolygons

If true, it will run a GiftWrap convex hull on all polygon inputs. This makes for a more stable engine when given random input, but if speed of the creation of polygons are more important, you might want to set this to false.

public const bool UseConvexHullPolygons = true

Field Value

bool

UseFpeCollisionCategories

Velcro Physics has a different way of filtering fixtures than Box2d. We have both FPE and Box2D filtering in the engine. If you are upgrading from earlier versions of FPE, set this to true and DefaultFixtureCollisionCategories to Category.All.

internal const bool UseFpeCollisionCategories = false

Field Value

bool

Methods

DefaultMixFriction(float, float)

Friction mixing law. The idea is to allow either fixture to drive the friction to zero. For example, anything slides on ice.

private static float DefaultMixFriction(float friction1, float friction2)

Parameters

friction1 float
friction2 float

Returns

float

DefaultMixRestitution(float, float)

Restitution mixing law. The idea is allow for anything to bounce off an inelastic surface. For example, a superball bounces on anything.

private static float DefaultMixRestitution(float restitution1, float restitution2)

Parameters

restitution1 float
restitution2 float

Returns

float

DefaultMixRestitutionThreshold(float, float)

Restitution mixing law. This picks the lowest value.

private static float DefaultMixRestitutionThreshold(float threshold1, float threshold2)

Parameters

threshold1 float
threshold2 float

Returns

float
